Description: A sherd of dull grey-brown pottery with part of a thick red-brown motif painted on an external cream slip. The motif comprises a vertical line crossed by a U- shaped one. It clearly comes from underneath one of the handles of a transport amphora imported from Chios.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.225, pl.67)
